meanings.definition: Capable of being recovered or regained.
meanings.sent1: The lost money was recoupable through careful budgeting.
meanings.sent2: The company hoped to recoupable its losses by increasing sales.
meanings.sent3: It was a recoupable mistake that could easily be fixed.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a recoupable treasure, brightening up the room.
meanings.sent5: The recoupable memories of childhood brought a sense of joy.

meanings.definition: Able to be compensated for or reimbursed.
meanings.sent1: The damaged goods were recoupable under the warranty.
meanings.sent2: She was assured that her expenses would be recoupable by the insurance company.
meanings.sent3: His forgetfulness was actually quite recoupable in the end.
meanings.sent4: The recoupable time spent waiting in line felt like a waste.
meanings.sent5: The recoupable effort put into the project paid off in the end.
